lines.content: This file records how AI tools were used during this project, what was changed, and what we learned.
Bring all Java source files in the project in line with the SE-EDU Java coding conventions (basic + intermediate).
- Standardized formatting to match conventions (indentation, braces, spacing, line wrapping).
- Made naming more consistent (e.g., collection variable names plural and descriptive).
- Ensured public APIs have clear, minimal Javadoc (especially for public classes/methods).
- Reduced unnecessary visibility where applicable (helper methods → `private`).
- Ensured consistency across files so the project reads like it was written by one person.
- Fast detection of repeated style issues (imports, whitespace, naming).
- Helpful at applying consistent conventions across multiple files in one sweep.
- Good at proposing safe refactors that don’t change behavior (renames, visibility tightening).
- It tried to create a package but I am not doing that in this project yet
Generate JavaDoc comments for most of the methods
- Fast detection of what the methods do and summarized it
- Helpful at applying consistent conventions across multiple files.
- Good at proposing changes to current comments
- Some of the comments were incorrect so had to manually check through and change it
Fix and add details to the README.md I originally edited
- Fast application of Github Flavoured Markdown
- Helpful at applying consistent conventions across the file.
- Some of the descriptions were incorrect

Biscuit is a lightweight task-tracking chatbot with a **GUI** (and CLI support) that helps you create, view, and manage tasks. Tasks are **saved automatically** and loaded again when you restart the app.
Type a command into the input box and press **Send** (or Enter). Biscuit will reply in the chat window.
Displays the different types of commands that Biscuit can accept, along with how to format each command.
Lists all tasks with their task numbers (used by `mark`, `unmark`, and `delete`).
Adds a todo task (a task with only a description).
The description of a todo cannot be empty.
Adds a deadline task (a task that must be done by a certain date).
If the date format is invalid:
Adds an event task (a task that happens over a time period).
Added: [E][ ] ballet rehearsal (from: Feb 07 2026 18:00 to: Feb 07 2026 20:00)
Usage: event <description> /from YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm /to YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm
If the end is before the start:
Event end must be after the event start.
Adds a task that must be completed within a date period (inclusive).
Added: [P][ ] collect certificate (between: Jan 15 2026 and Jan 25 2026)
If the end date is before the start date:
End date must be on or after the start date.
Marked as done: [D][X] EE draft (by: Feb 10 2026)
If the task number is invalid:
Please provide a valid task number to mark.
Marks a task as not done.
Marked as not done: [D][ ] EE draft (by: Feb 10 2026)
Finds tasks whose descriptions contain the keyword (case-insensitive).
No matching tasks found for: draft
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
